title: The Path Through The Ocean
opening: After Roy captured Aquleia, other Etrurian powers gradually began to change their views and express their discontent for the Revolutionaries. Driven away from their palace, Roartz and Arcard fled to Ilia, which was still under Bern’s control.

Ilia, also known as the Frozen Highlands, was a harsh land with short summers and long winters. With little arable land, the nation’s main source of income was to send out mercenary knights to fight for pay.

Etruria joined force with the Lycia Alliance Army to form a joint force under the name of the Etrurian Army, with Roy as its commander. Their first mission was to enter Ilia and finish off the remaining Revlutionaries. Once that was done, they would proceed to launch direct attacks on Bern. With the powerful backing of the Elimine Church, Roy had the populace on his side.

However, Roy had to face the freezing cold of Ilia, as well as Bern’s elite troops under General Murdock, the leader of the Three Dragon Lords. In addition, many of the powerful Ilian mercenary knights had submitted to Bern’s side.
As a start, Roy headed for Castle Raemy, located on the Ilian border.

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: So, Narshen has fallen.

intro.speaker: Galle
intro.line: Yes. Lord Murdock, did we really not have to aid him?

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: Those were the king’s orders. Besides, the Bern army has no use for a man who cannot clean up his own messes.

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: Lord Murdock... What will become of us?

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: Lord Arcard, I will entrust this land of Raemy to you. Lord Roartz, I will have you take the land of Edessa. You must make preparations to retaliate.

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: What!? Raemy is right on the border! The enemy will arrive in no time!

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: True. But this position also allows us to easily launch attacks on Etruria. Make sure this castle does not fall.

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: Edessa... It is deep in the wastelands of Ilia...

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: That would give you plenty of time to prepare your forces, would it not?

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: Could you not...take back Etruria for us?

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: We could. However, when we do, Etruria will go under Bern’s rule.

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: No! That won’t do.

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: Then I suggest that you find a way to deal with the situation yourselves. Excuse us.

intro.speaker: Galle
intro.line: My lord, were we supposed to dispose of those two like that?

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: Don’t worry. Bern’s code says that every individual must be able to deal with the consequences of his own actions. ...The enemy leader, was his name Roy?

intro.speaker: Galle
intro.line: Yes.

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: I must admit, he has done a superb job of rebuilding the Alliance Army after we crushed it so... If I have the chance, I would like to have the honor of fighting him one on one.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: We are soon approaching the Etrurian border.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Bishop Yoder, thank you for everything. Thanks to the Church, we were able to proceed thus far with ease.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Please. If you had not captured Aquleia, we would be suffering from persecution under Bern. This is nothing in comparison to what you did for us.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I am glad that I could be of use to you.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Now... May I ask you a very important favor?

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Yes, anything that I am capable of.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: If you find out anything else about the Dragons...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I understand. If I discover anything new, I will report to you immediately.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Thank you! ...Ah, yes, I must tell you something else. This land of Raemy... At a certain time of the day, the sea level drops, exposing a sand bar that can be crossed.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: A sand bar?

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Yes. It will take long to traverse all the way around the bay to attack the castle. However, should you be able to cross the sand bar, you may be able to save some time.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I see.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Still, please be careful. Rushing is not always the best tactic to win a battle.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Yes. Thank you for your advice.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Of course. Then, may Saint Elimine bless the Etrurian Army!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Lord Arcard! A path has appeared in the sea!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Well... According to the locals, the tide pulls at this time of day...

battle.speaker: Arcard
battle.line: What!? You didn’t know about this!?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: But, sir, we are not from these parts! We are not familiar with the geography of this land!

battle.speaker: Arcard
battle.line: Damn! Charge! Prevent the enemy from crossing that path!

battle.speaker: Merlinus
battle.line: Master Roy, we have a report.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: Did the path in the sea appear?

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: Did the enemy know about this?

battle.speaker: Merlinus
battle.line: Actually, they seem to be a panicked state.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: All right, then let’s not miss this chance! Charge!

boss.speaker: Arcard
boss.line: Wh-Why! Why is this happening to me!?

boss.speaker: Arcard
boss.line: I...am an Etrurian...noble! I must not...die...here... Guh!

boss.speaker: Klein
boss.line: You are the one who betrayed Etruria, Lord Arcard!

boss.speaker: Arcard
boss.line: D-Douglas! You had turned to the enemy...!?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Lord Arcard... What a pathetic ending for one who became so powerful.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Well, last year, I didn’t think we would be fighting in Sacae, either. Fate can turn out in the most unlikely ways... And that might be true for Bern as well.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: ...? Master Roy, what is it that you are holding in your hand?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Oh, this? This is the Fire Emblem.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Oh... So this tiny gem is...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Princess Guinevere wanted me to keep it. It seemed...difficult for her to give it to me... She must have been truly hoping to end the war peacefully until now...where this is no hope left...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Hmm... Trust between siblings? It didn’t seem likely on the outside.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: The enemy is Zephiel, king of Bern! It is said that he murdered his own father, so I didn’t think that he would be moved by mere family relations...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What!? He killed his own father?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Didn’t you know, Master Roy? Zephiel took the throne because the former king had died. But because the former king’s death was so sudden, there are many rumors going around.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: She must know something about it, if not all.
